Dialogue: by Andrew M. Niccol

Speaker: fade in
Dialogue: A white title appears on a black screen.  "As night-fall does not come at once, neither does oppression...It is in such twilight that we all must be aware of change in the air - however slight - lest we become victims of the darkness." Justice William O. Douglas

Speaker: director josef
Dialogue: You keep your work station so clean, Jerome.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: --Next to Godliness, isn't that what they say?

Speaker: director josef
Dialogue: I reviewed your flight plan.  Not one error in a hundred thousand keystrokes.  Phenomenal.  You have a substance test.

Speaker: lamar
Dialogue: Jerome...never shy.  Pisses on command. You've got a beautiful cock.  I ever told you that, Jerome?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Only every time I'm in here.

Speaker: lamar
Dialogue: I see a lot of cocks.  I speak from experience. Yours is a beautiful example.  Why didn't my folks order a cock like that for me?

Speaker: lamar
Dialogue: If everything goes to plan, this could be the last time I see you for a while.  One week to go.  Please tell me you're the least bit excited.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: I'll tell you at the end of the week.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: I can't do this.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: I told you, the government pays.  It's all taken care of.

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: No, you don't understand.  I can't.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: The doctor will give you something.

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: I'm not doing it.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: Honey, you've made one mistake--

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: You can have other children.

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: Not like this one.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: Honey, look around you.  The world doesn't want one like that one.

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: You don't know what it will be!

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: The child won't thank you!

Speaker: antonio
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: The name?  For the certificate.

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: Antonio--

Speaker: antonio
Dialogue: --No, Vincent Antonio.

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: Oh, Vincent, Vincent, Vincent...I can't let you out of my sight.

Speaker: geneticist
Dialogue: Put up the dish.

Speaker: geneticist
Dialogue: Your extracted eggs...  ...Maria, have been fertilized with... Antonio's sperm and we have performed an analysis of the resulting pre-embryos. After screening we're left with two healthy boys and two healthy girls.  Naturally, no critical pre-dispositions to any of the major inheritable diseases.  All that remains is to select the most compatible candidate.

Speaker: geneticist
Dialogue: First, we may as well decide on gender. Have you given it any thought?

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: We would like Vincent to have a brother... you know, to play with.

Speaker: geneticist
Dialogue: You've already specified blue eyes, dark hair and fair skin.  I have taken the liberty of eradicating any potentially prejudicial conditions - premature baldness, myopia, alcoholism and addictive susceptibility, propensity for violence and obesity--

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: --We didn't want--diseases, yes.

Speaker: antonio
Dialogue: We were wondering if we should leave some things to chance.

Speaker: geneticist
Dialogue: You want to give your child the best possible start.  Believe me, we have enough imperfection built-in already.  Your child doesn't need any additional burdens.  And keep in mind, this child is still you, simply the best of you. You could conceive naturally a thousand times and never get such a result.

Speaker: antonio
Dialogue: He's right, Maria.  That's right.

Speaker: geneticist
Dialogue: Is there any reason you'd want a left-handed child?

Speaker: antonio
Dialogue: Er, no...

Speaker: geneticist
Dialogue: Some believe it is associated with creativity, although there's no evidence.  Also for sports like baseball it can be an advantage.

Speaker: antonio
Dialogue: I like football.

Speaker: geneticist
Dialogue: I have to warn you, Mr Luca, he's going to be at least a head taller than you. Prepare for a crick in the neck in sixteen years time.

Speaker: geneticist
Dialogue: Anything I've forgotten?

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: We want him--we were hoping he would get married and have children.  We'd like grandchildren.

Speaker: geneticist
Dialogue: Now you appreciate I can only work with the raw material I have at my disposal but for a little extra...I could also attempt to insert sequences associated with enhanced mathematical or musical ability.

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: Antonio, the choir...

Speaker: geneticist
Dialogue: I have to caution you it's not fool-proof. With multi-gene traits there can be no guarantees.

Speaker: antonio
Dialogue: How much extra?

Speaker: geneticist
Dialogue: It would be five thousand more.

Speaker: antonio
Dialogue: I'm sorry, there's no way we can.

Speaker: geneticist
Dialogue: Don't worry.  You'll probably do just as well singing to him in the womb.  We can implant the most successful pre-embryo tomorrow afternoon.

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: What will happen to the others?

Speaker: geneticist
Dialogue: They are not babies, Maria, merely "human possibilities".

Speaker: geneticist
Dialogue: Smaller than a grain of sand.

Speaker: anton
Dialogue: How many astronauts are there, anyway?

Speaker: anton
Dialogue: I bet I could be one.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: You're standing on Venus.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Vincent, you have to be realistic.  A heart condition like yours--

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: --I don't care.  I'll take the risk.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: It's not just you they have to be concerned about.  Perhaps we could get you one of those new pacemakers.  They're not perfect but--

Speaker: father
Dialogue: For God's sake, Vincent, don't you understand. The only way you'll see the inside of a space ship is if you're cleaning it!

Speaker: anton
Dialogue: You sure you want to do this?

Speaker: antonio
Dialogue: Vincent, you damn fool!  You could have killed Anton with your ridiculous contest!  Why should he risk his life to save yours?!  When are you going to get it through your thick head--you can't compete with your brother!  Why try?!

Speaker: anton
Dialogue: Why didn't you say anything?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Why didn't you?  It's okay.  It's the way they want it.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: When you clean the glass, Vincent, don't clean it too well.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: You might get ideas.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: But if the glass is clean, it'll be easier for you to see me when I'm on the other side of it.

Speaker: owner
Dialogue: Where's Earl?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: He fell.  Lucky it was only the second floor.

Speaker: german
Dialogue: That's my name.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: What do you think?

Speaker: german
Dialogue: provided you know what you're doing and you can meet the terms.

Speaker: german
Dialogue: You got a photo of yourself?

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: I thought I told you not to get any ideas.

Speaker: german
Dialogue: Vincent...Vincent...

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: German, is that you?

Speaker: german
Dialogue: Vincent, come down.  I've found him.

Speaker: german
Dialogue: He has the heart of an ox.  He could run through a Goddamn wall--if he could still run. Actually, he was a big college swimming star.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I hope he's not just a body.

Speaker: german
Dialogue: No problem.  Before he dropped out he was an honor student, the right majors--

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: How do I square the accident?

Speaker: german
Dialogue: Excuse me, your life.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Where is he?

Speaker: german
Dialogue: (smiling confidently What did I tell you?  Which one's the mirror?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: That's the hair color in his profile?

Speaker: german
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I'd have to bleach my hair.

Speaker: german
Dialogue: Why are you inventing problems?  You two are a couple of goddam clones.  You look so right together, I want to double my fee.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: How tall are you?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Four foot six.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Okay, how tall did you used to be?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Six one.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: He's too tall.

Speaker: german
Dialogue: You can wear lifts.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Even with lifts I'm never that tall.

Speaker: german
Dialogue: There's a way.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: You okay, Jerome?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Yeah.  You want to go dancing tonight?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: What's wrong with it?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: I think I'd better choose the menu.  After all, you're learning how to be me, I'm not learning how to be you.

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: Suit yourself.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Listen, I don't want you to think I'm ungrateful --I know you and that little broker--what do you call him?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: German.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: You're both going to a lot of trouble--  ...but I was being groomed for something like this myself.  Even without the accident I don't think I would have made it.  My point is--how the hell do you expect to pull this off?

Speaker: vincent
Dialogue: I don't know exactly, Jerome.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Call me by my middle name--Eugene--If you're going to be Jerome, you may as well start getting used to it.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: I have to know where you come from.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: If anybody asks, tell them the truth-- your family disowns you.  You are a disappointment, Jerome.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: What about this?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Wrong color.  It's silver.  It's not easy living up to this.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: It needs work.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: You had to be a right-hander.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Noone orders southpaws anymore.

Speaker: german
Dialogue: It's no good.  I can see an edge.  He may as well walk in there with a cane.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: You really need that much?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: More than that.  You'll get used to it.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: God, what wouldn't you do to leave the planet?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Leave?  Just a few million years ago every atom in this hair--in our bodies--was a part of a star. I don't see it as leaving.  I see it as going home.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: God, you're serious, aren't you?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: It's not too late to back out.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: You don't know what a relief it is not to be me.  Are you sure you want the job?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: What about you?  What's in this for you, Eugene?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Listen, I bag this stuff anyway.  It may as well pay my rent.

Speaker: technician
Dialogue: Congratulations.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: What about the interview?

Speaker: technician
Dialogue: That was it.

Speaker: employee 1
Dialogue: Awful.

Speaker: employee 2
Dialogue: Yeah, awful it didn't happen sooner.

Speaker: director josef
Dialogue: You're lucky to be getting out of this.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: We're still going ahead as planned?

Speaker: director josef
Dialogue: The launch window is only open until week's end.  Tragic though this event may be, it hasn't stopped the planets turning.

Speaker: director josef
Dialogue: You'll have to excuse me, Jerome.  I have to meet with the authorities--naturally, we're co-operating in any way, although I won't tolerate a major disruption.  I wish I was going with you, Jerome.

Speaker: employee 3
Dialogue: What, no counselling?

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Excuse me, Jerome.  I'm sorry to bother you.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: No bother.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: I've been asked to compile a log for the investigators--they want to know everyone's whereabouts last night.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Last night?  I was at home.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Can that be, er, verified?  Were you alone?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: No it can't be verified.  Yes I was alone.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Looks bad, doesn't it, Irene?  What about you?  Where were you last night?

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: I was at home.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Were you alone?

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: So we don't know for sure about you, either.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Why don't we say we were together?

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Why would we do that?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: I have better things to do this week than answer the foolish questions of some flatfoot. Don't you?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Well, shall we say we spent the evening together?

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: To be convincing, Jerome, I would have to know what that was like.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: You didn't forget the truffles?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Who died?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: The Mission Director.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: You wish.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: They found him in his office this morning-- beaten so bad they had to check his nametag.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: What an act of benevolence--a service to the community.  So that's it.  Now there's nothing between you and ignition.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: He was still warm when they confirmed.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: This calls for a celebration.  Doesn't it?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: The place is crawling with Hoovers.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: So what?  You didn't kill him, did you?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: That's not the point.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Come on, we've got to get drunk immediately.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: You're going to have to earn your supper.  I've got my final physical tomorrow.

Speaker: technician
Dialogue: How old?

Speaker: young woman
Dialogue: Me?

Speaker: technician
Dialogue: The specimen.

Speaker: youung woman
Dialogue: I kissed him five minutes ago.  A real good one.

Speaker: technician
Dialogue: I'll see what I can do.

Speaker: michael
Dialogue: Good evening, gentlemen.  Your table is ready.  Not long now, sir.  You'll be upstairs before you know it.  We're going to miss you.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Not as much as I'll miss your Stroganoff. I'd like to take one of your chefs with me.

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: I'm so sorry.  Did I hurt you?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Honey, if you'd hurt me, I'd be cured.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: You want to meet a real-life spaceman?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Let's get out of here.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: You're right, there's more atmosphere where you're going.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: You drive.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: I gotta stop!!  I gotta stop!!

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Keep going!!  Keep going!!

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: You idiot.  You could ruin everything with a stunt like that.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: You'll all be showering in it, right?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: And drinking it.  It's like Evian by the time it's filtered.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: What is that one?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: How long do you stay up there before you go?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: A day or so.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: I still can't believe they're sending you to the Belt--you of all people--never meant to be born, on a mission to discover the origin of life.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: You should be going instead of me.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Up there they wouldn't be a problem.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: You know I'm scared of heights.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Let's see what you've got to say for yourself.

Speaker: assistant
Dialogue: The tongue is male.  Mature.  Blonse hair. Brown eyes.  Light complexion.  Between 5'11 and 6'1.  Pronounced Caucasian nose. Thin lips.  Weak chin.  Lobeless ears. Prematurely balding.  Slightly bow-legged. Broad shoulders.  Barrel chest...  Blind.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: The tongue is blind?

Speaker: assistant
Dialogue: Who cuts out the tongue of a blind man?

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Someone who is mindful that the blind still speak.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: I'm sorry.  Did you want it?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Let me get it for you.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: I'm sorry.  I'm sorry.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: It's okay, Eugene.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: You know I wasn't drunk--I knew what I was doing when I walked in front of that car--

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: --What car?--Go to sleep.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: --I walked right in front of it.  I was never more sober in my life.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: It's all right.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: I'm proud of you, Vincent.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: You must be drunk to call me Vincent.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: I don't understand why you were dragged out here, Sir.  It's hardly worth wasting your time--a no-nothing case like this.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: A man's dead, Detective.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: Of course, Sir.  We're checking the entry log, alibis, grudges...

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Grudges?

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: ...universally loved.  He was leading the cut-backs in the program.  You're looking at a room full of motives.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: No, this is your man.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: With respect, Sir--it may be the only unaccountable specimen but the profile suggests--

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: --What about his profile?

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: According to this, he's a sick man.  Congenital heart condition.  Who knows how long the specimen has been here but there's an 80 percent chance the owner of that eyelash has already died himself from natural causes.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: So there's a 20 percent chance he's not dead.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: Even if this Vincent Luca is alive, is it likely he could bludgeon a man to death?

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: No.  Not likely.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: I take it you're thinking along the lines of a robbery gone sour--a thief disturbed in the act?

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: Of course that doesn't jibe with what we found.  This was an angry killing.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Who knows with these "deficients"?  His profile indicates a proclivity for violence.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: I'll run a crossover on the eyelash for any family or associate connections--

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: --I've already run it.  There's no record of any living relative.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: What a pity.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Detective Hugo, it's a simple case of lost and found.  All we have to do is locate the man who's minus an eyelash and this murder will solve itself.

Speaker: medical director
Dialogue: Napoleon, you're late for your substance test.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Director, Napoleon's helping me today.

Speaker: medical director
Dialogue: Well, you take it for him, Jerome.

Speaker: napoleon
Dialogue: Why did you do that?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Don't worry about it.

Speaker: trainer
Dialogue: You're excused, Irene.  You may resume your duties.

Speaker: lamar
Dialogue: Six miles later it's still beating like a Goddamn metronome.  I could play piano by that heartbeat of his.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: Director Josef, this is our lead Investigator.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: How often do you test, Director?

Speaker: director josef
Dialogue: Often.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Surely you know what you have.

Speaker: director josef
Dialogue: We have to be certain.  Once they're up, we can hardly turn the boat around.

Speaker: lamar
Dialogue: I swear if I went to lunch and came back, he'd still be there.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: We believe we have a suspect.

Speaker: director josef
Dialogue: What a relief.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: This unaccountable specimen was found in the south wing corridor.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: An age enhancement is being prepared as we speak.

Speaker: director josef
Dialogue: Irene will make it available to security.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: I'll take care of that for you, Mr Morrow.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: We were looking at each other.  You stopped.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: I'm sorry.  I didn't mean anything.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: We were just looking.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: I know about you.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Here, take it.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: If you're still interested, let me know.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Sorry, the wind caught it.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Have they found our friend?

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Friend?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: It was a mercy-killing after all.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: They found an eyelash.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: In the South Wing.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Does it have a name?

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Just some In-Valid.  Vincent--  --somebody.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Perhaps we ought to celebrate, Irene.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: You celebrate, Jerome?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: --I know what I ordered.  I ordered "Honey Dawn" and you sent me "Summer Wheat".

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Any particular reason?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: We can't stay here.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: They think I offed the Director.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: What makes them think that?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: They found my eyelash.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: In a corridor.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Could be worse.  They could have found it in your eye.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Come on--we're taking off.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: I'm not going anywhere.  Less than a week to go. Not on your life--

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: --You don't understand, they'll make the connection, they'll hoover again.  We should cut our losses.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Where is your head, Jerome?  You're acting like a guilty man.  They won't marry the eyelash to you.  They won't believe that one of their elite navigators could have suckered them for the last five years.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: They'll recognize me.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: We'll take off all right, from pad 18 just like we planned.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: And keep your lashes on your lids where they belong.  How could you be so careless?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: I'm sorry.  I think I was crying.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Well save those tears.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: You really had other offers?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: I'm sure I could have.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Mind if I borrow a tie?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: So it's not just the Hoovers who've got you rattled.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: You're the one who said not to change anything. She's my ear to the investigation.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Is that all?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: I've got enough on my mind without that.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: If you say so.  The stripe.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Good choice.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Not thirsty?  We've got enough virgin samples to last us the week.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: I don't feel too good.  I think I'm still drunk from last night.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Never stopped you before.  And for God's sake stop plucking your hair. Someone went to a lot of trouble to make sure you wouldn't go bald.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: If I were you I'd worry about myself.  Haven't you forgotten something?

Speaker: german
Dialogue: We still need to overhaul the back-up generator.  What's going on, Eugene, I thought he was going away, not you--you going on vacation?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: You got it, German.

Speaker: german
Dialogue: You deserve it.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: Not our fish, but sometihng stuck in the net.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: This is the age enhancement we're working with.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: As you requested, we've kept the parameters wider than usual.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: We're in the wrong place.  We're wasting time.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: This is the most likely location--

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: --There's that word again.  I have a feeling This man doesn't play the odds, Detective.  Not exactly a slave to probability.  Is it "likely" that a man who has successfully eluded authorities for fifteen years--a brutal killer--is going to come to us now like a lamb?

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: Is there something more we should know about this suspect, Sir?  I mean besides what's on his sheet.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Since going underground, traces of this In-Valid have shown up at the scene of four serious felonies.  Do you need any more than that?

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: With respect, Sir, many perfectly innocent citizens have left specimens at as many crime scenes.  Maybe he's just unlucky.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: I don't like anybody this unlucky.  Widen the sweep.  The West side.  Draw a five mile radius around Gattaca.  Hoover some of the classier establishments.  Random car stops.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: We're already getting complaints about frivolous search.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: This is a murder investigation.  The public should be happy to co-operate, to get this disease off the streets.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: You didn't know?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Yes...yes...

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: You're angry--

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Why would I be angry?  It was beautiful.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Shit!  One of those Hoovers is back.

Speaker: valerie
Dialogue: It's alright.  He's here to see me.

Speaker: valerie
Dialogue: Sonja, I can't see anyone else tonight.

Speaker: valerie
Dialogue: I don't understand you, Investigator.

Speaker: valerie
Dialogue: You hunt us by day and fuck us by night.  Do you only get it up for In-valids?

Speaker: valerie
Dialogue: Wouldn't you be happier with one of your made-to-order whores?

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: You are so beautiful, are you sure you weren't altered?  This is not the face, the body, of a Godchild.  How could something so lovely be a product of chance?

Speaker: valerie
Dialogue: Is that what keeps you coming back?  Look at you.  Such angry, beautiful, perfect eyes. Do you ever wonder what they would see if they weren't quite so perfect?  They will never see what I see.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: You have so much wrong with you, you'll be lucky to see next year.

Speaker: valerie
Dialogue: Are you so much more alive, Investigator?

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: I'm not paying you to talk.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Don't want to give you a contaminated specimen...if you get my meaning.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Thanks.  You never know where those swabs have been.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: I want to show you something.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Come on!  We'll miss it!

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Come on.  We'll miss it.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: What did I tell you?

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: I envy you, Jerome.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: You'll be next.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: I don't think so.  The only trip I'll make in space is around the sun--  --on this satellite right here.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: --Listen, I don't want to waste your time and I really don't want you to waste mine. I don't know what you're after but I have a feeling I'm not it.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: I just want you to know what you'd be getting yourself into.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: What exactly is wrong?

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Nothing yet.  I'll start experiencing symptoms in my late-fifties.  But unless they come up with something between

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Of course I think about it every day.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Of course.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: How was your evening?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Complicated.  I couldn't stop her apologizing.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: What's wrong with her?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: You know how it is with these altered births --somebody told her she's not going to live forever and she's been preparing to die ever since.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: You're not thinking of telling her, are you?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Of course not.  But she's have to know eventually.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: She doesn't have to know.  She doesn't want to know.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: The skin flake was found in Michael's Restaurant. The employees are all accounted for.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: A customer?  Does this Michael's cater to misfits?

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: No.  But one or two "borrowed ladders" have shown up there in the past.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: We have to consider the possibility that he's playing somebody else's hand.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: He works at Gattaca.  Why else would we find the eyelash near the washroom?  Nobody stops to take a leak during a murder.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: It's still possible the eyelash specimen came from a janitor, delivery man--it could have blown in through an open window.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: He was afraid of being exposed.  That's why he did it.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: Even if you ignore the man's expiration date, his profile suggests that he doesn't have the mathematical propensity let alone the stamina to pass their physicals.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Don't underestimate these imposters.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: None of the ID photos match the enhancement.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Intravenous.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: At least go with a fingertip sample or urine.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Blood.  From the vein.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: Look like anybody to you?

Speaker: younger janitor
Dialogue: Not to me.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: Ugly sonofabitch though, isn't he?

Speaker: director josef
Dialogue: --Somewhere in the dust of Gaspra is the key.  Back to the beginning of the book--the life we became.  With the original building blocks who knows how far we can take "the godding".

Speaker: mission commander
Dialogue: Even someone as advanced as Jerome will be last year's model by the time we're done.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: I wouldn't get your hopes up, Commander.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Excuse me, Mr Morrow.  The investigators have begun their testing.

Speaker: detective josef
Dialogue: This is so inconvenient, Irene.  They can make an exception for Jerome.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: I'm afraid not.

Speaker: director josef
Dialogue: I apologize, Jerome.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: It's not yor fault, Director.  If your predecessor were still around we may not be going to Gaspra at all. That's what I would call inconvenient.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: What's with the plungers, Lamar?  What are you doing, opening a blood bank?

Speaker: lamar
Dialogue: The gentlemen of law enforcement are concerned that my testing methods may have been compromised.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Damn!!

Speaker: lamar
Dialogue: Jesus--I'm sorry, Jerome.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: You must be out of practise, Lamar.

Speaker: lamar
Dialogue: I've got enough here.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Need any more, you can always get it off his shoes.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: So you didn't do it after all.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: I guess somebody beat me to it.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: That's the last.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Something's not right.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: He's not here.  It's a blind alley.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: No, we've missed something.  We Hoover again.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: We don't have the manpower.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Get it.  From outside, if you have to.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: From what budget?

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: I'll take it out of your damn pension if you question my authority one more time!

Speaker: director josef
Dialogue: Would you care to look--in the telescope?

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Thank you, no.

Speaker: director josef
Dialogue: One look through there and you would know why I can't possibly allow you to disrupt operations any further.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: You're so unconcerned that you have a killer in your midst.

Speaker: director josef
Dialogue: Right now, your presence is creating more of a threat.  I don't think you have any concept of what we do here--how meticulous our preparations must be.  We are about to send twelve people through 140 million miles of blackness to rendezvous with an object the size of a house and the color of coal.  So it's rather critical to point them in the right direction. And we certainly don't need you looking over our shoulders.  Besides, I don't believe there is any evidence that the killer is amongst us.  I don't see too many other dead bodies littering the place.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: In the meantime we can re-check his favorite haunt.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: You see, Director, I prefer my microscope.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Where are we going?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: I'm sorry.  I've got plans.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Again?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: She's already got her doubts.  I have to act like nothing's wrong.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: I'm sure you'll be very convincing.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Where are you taking her?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Michael's.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Everybody goes there.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: You may as well invite her here.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Will you be okay?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Don't worry about your little pin cushion. To be honest, I'm looking forward to having the place to myself.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: We'll still be able to talk when I'm away. The conversation will just keep getting longer.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: How long?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: By the time I'm at the Belt, you phone and say, "How are you?"  Forty-five minutes later I reply, "Not bad.  How are you?"

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: I guess I'd better have something important to say if it takes that long to get an answer.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: What is this place?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Let me order for you.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: I'd better not.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: So sure of what you can't do.  Do you even know what it tastes like, Irene?

Speaker: michael
Dialogue: Take the side door.

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: Check for lenses, hairpieces--

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Why are we leaving?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Those checks take forever.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Jerome!

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: What about the car?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Let's walk.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Who are they?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: It's not safe.  I shouldn't have brought you here.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: I can't.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Come on.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: My medication.  I left it back there.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: We'll get it later.  Irene, please.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: You run a clean establishment.

Speaker: michael
Dialogue: Are you a health inspector?

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Do you recognize this man?

Speaker: michael
Dialogue: My eyes aren't so good.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: I bet.

Speaker: hugo
Dialogue: Sir.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Did he hit you with his fist?

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: More like a hammer.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Quick, clean his teeth.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Are you trying to kill me?  Are you?! Don't you understand, I can't do that!

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: You just did.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: What are you waiting for?

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: Where do we start?

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: We'll vacuum these streets if we have to.

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: We caught them trying to flush these, Sir.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: So sure of what you can't do.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: You remember the '99 Chrysler LeBaron? It's the exact height of the front fender.  Looked right instead of left.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: --if it came to it.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: But "if it came to it" then it couldn't have your--  How perfect does your child have to be?

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: You hypocrite.  Do you think for one moment you'd be doing what you're doing if it wasn't for who you are--what you are?  Don't you get any satisfaction knowing that your children will be able to live to a ripe old age unless they do something foolish?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: That's precisely what scaresme--that they won't do anything foolish or courageous or anything--worth a Goddamn.

Speaker: hugo
Dialogue: My wife and I--we're thinking of starting a family.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Why not?

Speaker: hugo
Dialogue: These new personality corrections I've been reading about.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: You worried about the cost?

Speaker: hugo
Dialogue: Not that.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: They said the same thing about myopia and obesity.  You think your children would be less human if they were less violent, angry, spiteful?  Maybe they'd be more human.  From where I sit the world could stand a little improving.

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: Don't touch that.  It's evidence.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: Positive saliva match.  The cup was definitely used since the original sweep.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: So we have two choices.  Either our suspect came back to the murder scene for a drink of water and I don't know anybody that thirsty or...  I'd like the profiles of everyone with an upcoming mission.

Speaker: director josef
Dialogue: Twelve have a mission within the week.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: This time I will supervise each test personally.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: I forgot something--something at home. I'll see you later.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: I'll miss you.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: --when you go away.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: We could go together one day.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: He's the only absentee.

Speaker: director josef
Dialogue: A little nausea.  Quite common.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: At least it's nothing contagious.

Speaker: director josef
Dialogue: I will not permit any further testing on the eve of a mission.  We're already counting backwards.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: I'll call and let him know.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Let's not spoil the surprise.  I understand you can show us the way.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Hello?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: I was never very good at it, remember?

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: You don't know who he is, do you, Irene?

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: You think you have problems?

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Jerome--?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Hello, sweatheart.  Come on up.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Where's my kiss?

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Good to see you're feeling better.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Now you're here.  Who are your "friends"?

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: It's about the Director.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Again?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Forgive me for not getting up.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Couldn't we do this another time?

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: I don't believe so.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: This won't take a moment.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: It's okay.  Maybe they can find out what I've got.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Mind if I take a leak?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: As long as you don't do it in my closet.  Over there.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: May I?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Clean the whole house if you want.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Actually, the kitchen needs doing.

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: Come quickly.  We have him.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: How are you, Jerome?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Not bad, Jerome.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: How the hell did you get here.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: I could always walk.  I've been faking it.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Irene.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: This can't be him.

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: We found his spit in the dead director's eye. He's signed a confession--supplied us with the suit he wore on the night.  What more do you want?

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Luca could still be an accomplice.

Speaker: mission commander
Dialogue: --Finally, I'd like to welcome Navigator Morrow on his debut mission--if we get lost out there, nobody has a map of the heavens in his head like Jerome.

Speaker: mission commander
Dialogue: Gaspra--how could something so ugly hold so many beautiful secrets?

Speaker: mission commander
Dialogue: Enjoy your final evening with your families. We'll all be a year older when they see us next.  And don't be late tomorrow.  You don't want to miss this.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Hugo!  I've found him!

Speaker: hugo
Dialogue: I've found him too.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: What did you find?

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: It's not exactly him.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Where did you get this?

Speaker: detective hugo
Dialogue: But this man does share some common characteristics with your suspect.  Not so many but enough.  It appears the eyelash has a brother--of a kind.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: So you've finally seen sense and come back to your old job, Vincent.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Not yet, I'm afraid.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: No?  What's keeping you?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: I guess I'm a slow learner.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: I guess so.  Well, while you're up there, maybe you could tidy the place up a bit.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: I'll see what I can do.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: And don't go getting everybody lost out there. You'll give us a bad name.  You won't have me to keep an eye on you, you know.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: By the way, I left some trash in your locker.

Speaker: caesar
Dialogue: I'll take care of it.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Vincent--

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Vincent, what are you running from?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: From Vincent.

Speaker: investigator
Dialogue: Has it been so long, you don't remember who I am?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: What are you doing here, Anton?

Speaker: anton
Dialogue: I could ask you the same question.  I have a right to be here, you don't.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: You almost sound like you believe that.

Speaker: anton
Dialogue: Come with me now, Vincent.  You've gone as far as you can go.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: There are a few million miles to go yet.

Speaker: anton
Dialogue: It's over.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Is that the only way you can succeed, Anton, to see me fail?

Speaker: anton
Dialogue: It's for the best.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: God, even you want to tell me what I can't do. In case you hadn't noticed, Anton, I don't need rescuing.  But you did, once.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Well?  You have all the answers.  How is that possible?

Speaker: anton
Dialogue: You didn't beat me that day.  I beat myself.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Who are you trying to convince?

Speaker: anton
Dialogue: I will prove it to you.  Come swim with me now, Vincent.  Now--tonight.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Hello.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: That's where we get rid of the traces of him although we never truly succeeded.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: I've been looking for him.  Do you know where he is?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: He's probably leaving some more of me around the place before he goes.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Don't be deceived, Irene.  These are just the clothes.  He has to wear them. Something I could never do.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: What's wrong with him?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: You have more in common than you know.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: But they say hisis already ten thousand beats overdue.  I have my doubts.  For all my gifts, they could never engineer me a heart like Vincent's.

Speaker: anton
Dialogue: How are you doing this, Vincent?  How have you done any of this?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Now is your chance to find out.

Speaker: anton
Dialogue: Vincent, where's the shore?  We're too far out. We have to go back!

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Too late for that.  We're closer to the other side.

Speaker: anton
Dialogue: What other side?  How far do you want to go?! Do you want to drown us both?  How are we going to get back?!

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: You wanted to know how I did it.  That's how I did it, Anton.  I never saved anything for the swim back.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Here, take it.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: If you're still interested, let me know.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Sorry, the wind caught it.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: A year is a long time.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Not so long--just once around the sun.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: I have your samples ready.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Have you forgotten?  I don't need any samples where I'm going.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: No, but you might need them when you get back.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Everything you need to last you two lifetimes.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: There's an extra specimen.  I wish I could give it to her myself.  But then, you always were better at being me.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Why have you done this?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: In case you get back before I do.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Where are you going?

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: I'm travelling too.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: I got the better end of the deal.  I just lent you my body--you lent me your dream.

Speaker: eugene
Dialogue: Not until you're upstairs.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: What's this, Lamar?

Speaker: lamar
Dialogue: New policy.

Speaker: lamar
Dialogue: Flight got you nervous?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: There's a problem, Lamar.

Speaker: lamar
Dialogue: Did I ever tell you about my son, Jerome?  He's a big fan of yours.  He wants to apply here.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: Just remember, Lamar, I could have gone up and back and nobody would have been the wiser--

Speaker: lamar
Dialogue: --Unfortunately my son's not all that they promised.  But then, who know what he could do.

Speaker: lamar
Dialogue: For future reference--  --righthanded men don't hold it with their left.  It's just one of those things.

Speaker: lamar
Dialogue: Have a safe trip, Vincent.

Speaker: homer
Dialogue: Blind from birth

Speaker: napoleon bonaparte
Dialogue: Epileptic

Speaker: colette
Dialogue: Arthritic

Speaker: lou gerhig
Dialogue: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis

Speaker: rita hayworth
Dialogue: Alzheimer's Disease

Speaker: helen keller
Dialogue: Blind and deaf

Speaker: stephen hawking
Dialogue: Lou Gerhig's Disease

Speaker: charles darwin
Dialogue: Chronic invalid
